content.body: Right, this is why I concluded that the only reference point we could use is the module system
content.formatted_body: Right, this is why I concluded that the only reference point we could use is the module system

content.body: just like builtin modules, there'd always have to be a way to access the same functionality in Scripts - how would that work at all with the module system?

Automatically de-duping types based on module could also be difficult when the bundler inlines the defining module into separate main and worker bundles. It would need to know this module is an entry-point that should not be inlined
content.formatted_body: Automatically de-duping types based on module could also be difficult when the bundler inlines the defining module into separate main and worker bundles. It would need to know this module is an entry-point that should not be inlined
